The Republican: led Florida Legislature approved a controversial election law in 2011 that required third-party groups to submit voter registrations within 48 hours or face fines.
Civic groups: including the Florida League of Women Voters, challenged the law, arguing that it would suppress the minority vote.
A New York Times article from March 2012: 4. It is difficult to determine the exact impact of the law on the decrease in voter registrations, as other factors such as decreased excitement compared to the 2008 race could also be contributing.
